Package net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math

Class AbstractPiecewiseConstant

java.lang.Object
net.sourceforge.plantuml.project.ngm.math.AbstractPiecewiseConstant
Record Components:
instant - the instant from which to start iterating; the first segment returned will begin exactly at this instant
All Implemented Interfaces:
PiecewiseConstant
Direct Known Subclasses:
Combiner.CombinedPiecewiseConstant, PiecewiseConstantHours, PiecewiseConstantSpecificDays, PiecewiseConstantWeekday
public abstract class AbstractPiecewiseConstant extends Object implements PiecewiseConstant
Base class for PiecewiseConstant implementations whose value is constant over contiguous time segments.

This class provides a implementation of #iterateSegmentsFrom(LocalDateTime) that lazily iterates over successive segments, starting from the segment that contains a given instant.

The iterator returned by this method has the following properties:

  • The first segment returned is the segment that contains the given instant, but it is trimmed so that it starts exactly at instant.
  • Each subsequent segment starts exactly where the previous one ends (end-exclusive), ensuring a continuous, gap-free iteration.
  • The iterator is conceptually unbounded: Iterator.hasNext() always returns true.

This method relies on the concrete implementation of #segmentAt(LocalDateTime) to locate the segment covering a given instant. It does not precompute or materialize all segments, making it suitable for efficient forward traversal over long or infinite timelines.

Important: Implementations of #segmentAt(LocalDateTime) must guarantee that the returned segment:

  • contains the provided instant,
  • has a strictly increasing endExclusive instant,
  • is consistent with adjacent segments so that repeated calls with successive instants form a coherent timeline.

Violating these assumptions may result in infinite loops or incorrect segment boundaries during iteration.

  • Method Details

    • iterateSegmentsFrom

      public final Iterator<Segment> iterateSegmentsFrom(LocalDateTime instant, TimeDirection direction)
      Description copied from interface: PiecewiseConstant
      Returns an iterator over segments in ascending chronological order, starting from the segment that contains the given instant.

      Important: The first segment returned by this iterator is the segment that contains instant, but this segment does not necessarily start at instant. The segment may have started before instant and extends beyond it. Subsequent segments follow in chronological order.

      This method is intended for efficient forward traversal when computing or aggregating workload over time windows without materializing all segments.

      This iterator may represent a large or conceptually unbounded sequence, depending on the underlying workload rules.

      Specified by:
      iterateSegmentsFrom in interface PiecewiseConstant
      Parameters:
      instant - the instant from which to begin iteration; the first segment returned will be the one containing this instant
      Returns:
      an iterator over segments containing and following the given instant
